title: Confusing diagnostic when typoing `Wrapper(t): Wrapper<t>` in a function signature

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code:

https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=57d52025a7f3f79dae1ff241d9e7a243

```rust
struct Wrapper<T>(T);
struct Foo;

fn takes_a_wrapped_foo(Wrapper(foo): Wrapper<foo>) { // << was supposed to be Wrapper<Foo>
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[[E0435]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0435): attempt to use a non-constant value in a constant
 --> src/lib.rs:4:46
  |
4 | fn takes_a_wrapped_foo(Wrapper(foo): Wrapper<foo>) {
  |                                ---           ^^^
  |                                |
  |                                this would need to be a `const`
```

Ideally the output should look like:

Something like "did you mean `Wrapper<Foo>`?"

CC @estebank
